criterion: Provides a complete medical note with all required information for an outpatient evaluation.
Does not include vital signs in the medical note.
Accurately describes the patient's symptoms, including difficulty swallowing.
Provides a clear and concise medical note.
Does not ask clarifying questions about the patient's symptoms or medical history.
Does not provide a clear plan for further evaluation or treatment.
Provides a detailed description of the patient's symptoms, including the onset and duration.
Provides a clear and concise summary of the patient's medical history.
Does not include a review of systems or physical examination findings.
Accurately describes the patient's medical history, including seasonal allergies.
